description: TO PASS H. R. 3 (3 STAT. 401, APP. 12/23/1817), A BILL ABOLISHING THE INTERNAL DUTIES AS THE GOVERNMENT'S INCOME HAS BECOME EXCESSIVE.  (P.424)
TO PASS A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT BOTH HOUSES ADJOURN FROM THE 24TH THROUGH THE 29TH OF DECEMBER.  (P. 508)

TO AMEND H. R. 28 (1/22/1818), A BILL FIXING THE COMPEN- SATION OF MEMBERS OF THE SENATE, THE HOUSE AND DELEGATES OF THE TERRITORIES, AND REPLACING ALL OTHER LAWS ON THE SUBJECT, WHICH AMENDMENT WOULD REDUCE THE PER DIEM ALLOWANCE FROM $9. TO $6. WHILE I ATTENDANCE ON CONGRESS
TO AMEND H. R. 28, BY REDUCING THE ALLOWANCE FOR TRAVELING TO AND FROM CONGRESS FROM $9.00 TO $6.00 FOR EVERY 20 MILES FROM AND TO THE CAPITOL.  (P.576)
TO AMEND H. R. 28, BY REDUCING THE PER DIEM PAY FROM $9.00 TO $8.00 TO MEMBERS OF CONGRESS DURING THEIR ATTENDANCE ON CONGRESS.  (P.577)
TO PASS H. R. 28, AS AMENDED SO THAT THE PAY FOR MEMBERS OF CONGRESS BE FIXED AT $8.00 PER DAY, AND $8.00 PER 20 MILES TRAVELING ALLOWANCE TO AND FROM CONGRESS.  (P. 590)
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT COL. JOHN ANDERSON BE BROUGHT TO THE BAR OF THE HOUSE AND CITED FOR CONTEMPT IN THAT HE OFFERED TO BRIBE A MEMBER OF THE HOUSE.  (P.773)

TO SUBSTITUTE A RESOLUTION FOR THE ONE RELATING TO JOHN ANDERSON WHICH SUBSTITUTE PROVIDES THAT THE HOUSE, HAVING DOUBTS OF ITS POSSESSING THE COMPETENT POWER TO PUNISH JOHN ANDERSON FOR HIS CONTEMPT OF THE HOUSE, (OFFERING TO BRIBE A MEMBER); RESOLVED TAT ALL FORTHCOMING PROCEEDINGS AGAINST HIS CASE CEASE AND THE ATTORNEY GENERAL BE DIRECTED TO IN- STITUTE SUCH PROCEEDINGS AS MAY BE AGREEABLE TO U
TO ADOPT A RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT COL. JOHN ANDERSON BE BROUGHT TO THE BAR OF THE HOUSE.  (P.775)

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION WHICH STATES THAT JOHN ANDERSON HAS COMMITTED A HIGH CONTEMPT AGAINST THE PRIVILEGES OF THIS HOUSE, AND SHOULD BE REPRIMANDED, AND THEREUPON DISCHARGED WITHOUT FURTHER PUNISHMENT IN CONSIDERATION OF HIS SACRI- FICES, SUFFERING ANDATTACHMENT TO THE U

TO PASS H. R. 18, A BILL AMENDING AN ACT ENTITLED "AN ACT RESPECTING FUGITIVES FROM JUSTICE, AND PERSONS ESCAPING FROM THE SERVICES OF THEIR MASTERS."  (P.513)

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO H.R. 63 (APP. 3-9-1818), A BILL FOR THE RELIEF OF MAJOR GENERAL ARTHUR ST. CLAIR, WHICH AMENDMENT GRANTS THE SUM OF $50. PER MONTH AS A PENSION INSTEAD OF $60. FOR SERVICES RENDERED DURING THE REVOLUIONARY WAR

TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT OF THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO H. R. 63 (APP. 3/9/1818), A BILL FOR THE RELIEF OF MAJ. GEN. A. ST. CLAIR, WHICH AMENDMENT GRANTS A PENSION OF SIXTY DOL- LARS A MONTH TO GEN. ST. CLAIR.  (P.853)

TO ORDER THE ENGROSSMENT AND 3RD READING OF H. R. 37, A BILL CONCERNING HALF PAY PENSIONS, INVALID PENSIONS AND ETC. (P.880)

TO CONCUR IN AN AMENDMENT OF THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO H. R. 15, A BILL PROVIDING THE MANNER IN WHICH CITIZENSHIP MAY BE RELINQUISHED, WHICH AMENDMENT STRIKES OUT THE FIRST SECTION OF THE BILL PROVIDING THAT ANY PERSON CAN APPLY TO THE DISTRICT COURTOF THE U
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY H. R. 15.

TO AMEND SECTION 2 OF H. R. 15, BY PROVIDING THAT IN ALL PROSECUTIONS AGAINST ANY PERSON FOR ENGAGING IN A WAR FOR OR AGAINST A FOREIGN POWER, WHEN WITHOUT THE JURISDICTION OF THE U. S. AND NOT IN HOSTILITY AGAINST SAID STATE, IF THAT PERSON SHALL VOLUNTRILY HAVE BECOME A CITIZEN OR SUBJECT OF ANY FOREIGN STATE HAVING EXCERCISED HIS RIGHT OF EXPATRI- ATION, IT SHALL BE LAWFUL FOR SUCH PERSONS TO SO STATE AT HIS TRIAL AND UPON PROOF OF SUCH FACT TO THE JURY HE SHALL BE DISCHARGED FROM SUCH PROSECUTION
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY H. R. 16, A BILL PROVIDING PAYMENT OF CLAIMS OF THE STATE OF GEORGIA FOR CERTAIN MILITARY SER- VICES RENDERED IN 1793 AND 1794.

TO AMEND H. R. 8 (30 STAT. 410, APP. 3/18/1818), A BILL PRO- VIDING A PENSION FOR CERTAIN OFFICERS AND SOLDIERS OF THE REVOLUTIONARY ARMY, WHICH AMENDMENT STRIKES OUT "ON THE CON- TINENTAL ESTABLISHMENT," SO AS TO EMBRACE THOSE WHO SERVED FOR NINE MONTHSAND WERE IN SERVICE AT THE END OF THE WAR AND THUS INCLUDING THE MILITIA AS WELL AS THE REGULAR
TO ORDER THE ENGROSSMENT AND 3RD READING OF H. R. 16, A BILL PROVIDING PAYMENT OF CLAIMS OF THE STATE OF GEORGIA FOR CER- TAIN MILITARY SERVICES RENDERED IN 1793, 1794.

TO REJECT A PETITION PROTESTING THE INVESTMENT AND CAPTURE OF AMELIA ISLAND IN E. FLORIDA, ON BEHALF OF THE AUTHORITIES OF VENEZUELA, NEW GRANADA AND MEXICO.

TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOL- UTION PROVIDING THAT CONGRESS HAS THE POWER TO APPROPRIATE MONEY FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF POST ROADS, MILITARY AND OTHER ROADS AND FOR THE IMPROVEMENT OF WATER COURSES.

TO CONCUR IN AN AMENDMENT MADE AS IN THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO CONGRESSIONAL AUTHORITY WHICH AMENDMENT IS THE 1ST AND STRIKES OUT ALL THE RESOL- UTIONS AFTER THE WORD "RESOLVED", INSERTING "THAT CONGRESS HAS POWER UNDER THECONSTITUTION TO APPROPRIATE MONEY FOR CONSTRUCTION OF POST ROADS, MILITARY AND OTHER ROADS, AND FOR THE IMPROVEMENT OF WATER COURSES."  (P.1385)

TO CONCUR IN THE 2ND AMENDMENT TO THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO CONGRESSIONAL AUTHORITY, MADE AS IN THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, WHICH AMENDMENT AFFIRMS THE RIGHT OF CONGRESS TO CON- STRUCT ROADS PROVIDED THE OWNER OF PRIVATE PROPERTY TAKEN BE COMPENSATED.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO CONGRESSIONAL AUTHORITY, WHICH AMENDMENT RESERVES TO THE STATES THE RIGHT TO GIVE THEIR CONSENT BEFORE PROPERTY WAS ACQUIRED BY INSERTING AFTER THE WORDS "STATES", THE FOLLOWING, "WITH THE CONSENT OF THE STATES THROUGHWHICH THEY PASS."

TO CONCUR IN THE 3RD AMENDMENT MADE AS IN THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO CONGRESSIONAL AUTH- ORITY, WHICH AMENDMENT AFFIRMS THE RIGHT OF CONGRESS TO CON- STRUCT ROADS AND CANALS NECESSARY FOR COMMERCE BETWEEN THE STATES PROVIDEDTHAT PRIVATE PROPERTY BE NOT TAKEN FOR PUBLIC PURPOSES WITHOUT JUST COMPENSATION.

TO CONCUR IN THE 4TH AMENDMENT MADE AS IN THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO THE RESOLUTION RELATING TO CONGRESSIONAL AUTH- ORITY, WHICH AMENDMENT AFFIRMS THE RIGHT OF CONGRESS TO CON- STRUCT CANALS FOR MILITARY PURPOSES PROVIDING JUST COMPENSA- TION BE MADE OR THE TAKING OF PRIVATE PROPERTY.
TO ORDER 3RD READING OF S. 6 (APP. 3/27/1818), A BILL FOR "AN ACT IN ADDITION TO AN ACT MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR RE- PAIRING CERTAIN ROADS THEREIN DESCRIBED".

TO AMEND H. R. 8, BY INSERTING IN SECTION 1, LINE 12 IN PLACE OF "THEREOF FOR THE TERM OF THREE YEARS" THE FOLLOWING "OR DURING THE WHOLE TERM FOR WHICH THEY WERE ENGAGED, UN- LESS THEY WERE DISCHARGED, OR LEFT THE SERVICE THROUGH SOME DERANGEMENT OF THEARMY, OR IN CONSEQUENCE OF THEIR DISABI- LITY RESIGNED THEIR COMMISSION, OR WERE IN CAPTIVITY OR ON PAROLE UNTIL THE CLOSE OF THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR".
TO AMEND H. R. 8, BY INSERTING IN SECTION 1, A PROVISION MAKING NINE MONTHS THE MINIMUM LENGTH OF SERVICE FOR PENSION ELIGIBILITY.

AND THE APPOINTMENT OF CIRCUIT JUDGES TO THE COM- MITTEE ON JUDICIARY, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT SAME BACK WITH PROVISIONS FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF ONE OR MORE ADDITION- AL JUSTICES OF HE SUPREME COURT, AND FOR ALTERING THE PRE- SENT DIVISIONS OF THE UNITED STATES INTO CIRCUITS, THUS PRO- VIDING FOR THE MORE SPEEDY ADMINISTRATION OF JUSTICE IN THE STATES OF TENNESSEE, KENTUCKY, LOUISIANA, INDIANA, MISSISSIPPI AND ILLINOIS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL FOR THE MORE CONVENIENT ORGANIZATION OF THE COURTS OF THE UNITED STATES AND THE APPOINTMENT OF CIRCUIT JUDGES.

TO REFER TO A SELECT COMMITTEE THE JOINT RESOLUTION FOR AMENDMENT OF THE CONSTITUTION BY ALTERING THE MODE OF CHOOS- ING ELECTORS OF PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT, AND OF REPRE- SENTATIVES IN CONGRESS, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO MODIFY SAID RESOLUTION SO THAT TE CHOICE OF PRESIDENT SHALL BE MADE BY A PLURALITY OF VOTES AND NOT BY STATES.
TO PASS THE BILL FOR THE MORE CONVENIENT ORGANIZATION OF THE COURTS OF THE UNITED STATES AND FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF CIR- CUIT JUDGES.

TO AMEND THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 480, APP. 2/15/1819), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE MILITARY SERVICE OF THE UNITED STATES FOR 1819, SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE APPROPRIATION OF $10,000 FOR EXTRA PAY TO NON-COMMISSIONED OFFICERS AND SOLD- IERS, EMPLOYEDIN THE CONSTRUCTION AND REPARIRS OF MILITARY ROADS.

TO AMEND THE PETITION PROVIDING FOR THE CLAIM OF JACOB PURKHILL; SAID AMENDMENT TO INSTRUCT THE COMMITTEE ON CLAIMS TO BRING IN A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE PAYMENT OF SLAVES LOST TO THEIR OWNERS, BY BEING IMPRESSED INTO THE MILITARY SERVICE OF THE UNITED STTES.
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING FOR THE CLAIM OF JACOB PURKHILL, SAID AMENDMENT TO INSTRUCT THE COMMITTEE ON CLAIMS TO BRING IN A BILL FOR THE RELIEF OF PETITIONER.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING THE CONVENTION MADE IN LONDON OCT. 20, 1818, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND GREAT GRITAIN AND IRELAND.
TO AGREE TO REPORT OF COMMITTEE ON FINANCE DENYING THE PET- ITION OF NATHANIEL GODDARD, AND OTHERS, FORMERLY OWNERS OF THE SHIP ARIADNE, AND HER CARGO.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY THE BILL PRESCRIBING THE MODE OF COMMENCING, PROSECUTION, AND DECIDING CONTROVERSIES BETWEEN TWO OR MORE STATES.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL MARCH 5TH NEXT, THE BILL PRESCRIBING THE MODE OF COMMENCING, PROSECUTING, AND DECIDING CONTROVERSIES BETWEEN TWO OR MORE STATES.
TO PASS THE JOINT RESOLUTION PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION PROVIDING FOR A UNIFORM MODE OF ELECTING ELEC- TORS OF PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT, AND REPRESENTATIVES IN CONGRESS.

TO POSTPONE UNTIL MARCH 5, 1819, THE BILL EXTENDING FOR FIVE YEARS THE PENSIONS HERETOFORE GRANTED TO THE WIDOWS AND OR- PHANS OF THE OFFICERS AND SOLDIERS WHO DIED, OR WERE KILLED, IN THE LATE WAR WITH GREAT BRITAIN.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL MARCH 5TH NEXT, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR THE ERECTION OF AN EQUESTRIAN STATUE OF GENERAL WASHINGTON IN CAPITOL SQUARE.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL MARCH 5TH THE BILL PROVIDING FOR THE EREC- TION OF AN EQUESTRIAN STATUE OF GENERAL WASHINGTON IN THE CAPITOL SQUARE.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL PROVIDING FOR THE ERECTION OF AN EQUESTRIAN STATUE OF GENERAL GEORGE WASHINGTION IN CAPITOL SQUARE, IF THE COST IS TO EXCEED $150,000, THE PRESIDENT IS REQUESTED TO REPORT THE COST TO THE NEXT SESSION OFCONGRESS.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL MARCH 5TH NEXT, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR THE ERECTION OF AN EQUESTRIAN STATUE OF GENERAL WAHSINGTON IN THE CAPITOL SQUARE.
TO CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF WALTER BOWNE TO BE A DIRECTOR OF THE BANK OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO REFER TO A SELECT COMMITTEE THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 484, APP. 2/20/1819), INCREASING THE SALARIES OF CERTAIN OFFICERS OF THE GOVERNMENT, WITH IN- STRUCTIONS TO PROVIDE FOR AN INCREASE IN THE SALARIES OF THE DISTRICT JUDGES.

TO AGREE TO AMENDMENT OF COMMITTEE ON JUDICIARY TO BILL (3 STAT. L. 484, APP. 2/20/1819), INCREASING THE SALARIES OF CERTAIN OFFICERS OF THE GOVERNMENT, SAID AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT THE SALARIES OF CHIEF JUSTICE OF THE U. S. BE $5,000; AND OF THE JUDGESOF THE U

TO POSTPONE TO MARCH 5TH, NEXT, THE RESOLUTION ADDING A NEW MEMBER TO THE COMMITTEE ALREADY APPOINTED ON THE SUBJECT OF THE SEMINOLE WAR IN THE PLACE OF THE HONORABLE MR. FORSYTH, RECENTLY APPOINTED TO A FOREIGN MISSION.
TO AMEND THE BILL MAKING FURTHER PROVISION RESPECTING THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS, SAID AMENDMENT TO RESTRICTING SUCH SALES OF PUBLIC ROADS AFTER A GIVEN DATE, TO CASH ONLY IN CERTAIN LAND OFFICES.

TO AMEND TH PUBLIC LAND BILL BY ELIMINATING FROM THE 3RD SECTION THE PROVISION WHICH PRESCRIBES THE PRICE PER ACRE AT $1.50, PAYABLE AT THE TIME OF MAKING SUCH ENTRY, AND SUB- STITUTING A NEW SCALE OF PRICES.

TO AMEND THE PUBLIC LAND BILL BY PROVIDING THAT ANY PERSON ACTUALLY SETTLED ON ANY QUARTER SECTION OF LAND PREVIOUSLY OFFERED AT PUBLIC SALE AND REMAINING UNSOLD, SHALL BE EN- TITLED TO RECEIVE A LICENSE TO REMAIN ON SAID LAND FOR FIVE YEARS, AND DURING HIS PERIOD SHALL HAVE THE PRIOR RIGHT TO PURCHASE SAID LAND BY PAYING FOR IT, PLUSE INTEREST FROM DATE OF HIS LICENSE.
TO AMEND THE PUBLIC LAND BILL BY FORBIDDING THE SALE OF MORE THAN ONE SECTION OF LAND TO ONE PERSON IN ANY ONE YEAR.
TO AMEND THE PUBLIC LAND BILL BY FIXING THE MINIMUM PRICE AT WHICH PUBLIC LAND SHALL BE OFFERED AT PUBLIC SALE AT $1.00 PER ACRE INSTEAD OF $1.50.
TO AMEND THE PUBLIC LAND BILL BY REDUCING THE PRICE AT WHICH PUBLIC LAND SHALL BE OFFERED AT PUBLIC SALE FROM $1.50 TO $1.25 PER ACRE.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL MARCH 5TH NEXT THE PUBLIC LAND BILL.
TO FILL THE BLANKS IN THE PUBLIC LAND BILL BY PUTTING THE ACT INTO OPERATION ON 10/1/1820.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY THE BILL RESPECTING THE TRANSPORTA- TION OF PERSONS OF COLOR FOR SALE, OR TO BE HELD TO LABOR.

TO AMEND THE APPROPRIATION BILL FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR 1819, SAID AMENDMENT TO APPROPRIATE THE SUM OF $535,000 FOR CONSTRUCTING AND COMPLETING THE UNITED STATES ROADS FROM CUMBERLAND TO THE OHIO RIVER.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING THE TREATY OF AMITY, SETTLE- MENT AND LIMITS MADE ON FEB. 22, 1819, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA AND SPAIN, WITH REFERENCE TO THE FLORIDAS.
TO ORDER PRINTING OF A REPORT FROM THE APPOINTED COMMITTEE INQUIRING INTO ACTIVITIES CONCERNING THE SEMINOLE WAR IN WEST FLORIDA.

TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 493, APP. 3/2/1819), AUTHORIZING THE PEOPLE OF MISSOURI TO FORM A CONSTITUTION PRELIMINARY TO THE ADMISSION OF THE TERRITORY INTO THE UNION AS A STATE.

TO AMEND A BILL (3 STAT. L. 493, APP. 3-2-1819), AUTHORIZING THE PEOPLE OF MO. TO FORM A CONSTITUTION; SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE CLAUSE PROVIDING THAT ALL CHILDREN OF SLAVES, BORN WITHIN THE SAID STATE AFTER THE ADMISSION THEREOF INTO THE UNION SHAL BE FREE, BUT MAY BE HELD TO SERVICE UNTIL 25 YEARS OF AGE.

TO AMEND THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 493, APP. 3/2/1819), AUTHOR- IZING THE PEOPLE OF MISSOURI TO FORM A CONSTITUTION; SAID AMENDMENT ELIMINATES THE PROVISO THAT PROHIBITS THE FURTHER INTRODUCTION OF SLAVERY OR INVOLUNTARY SERVITUDE, EXCEPT FOR THE PUNISHMENT O CRIME WHEREOF THE PARTY SHALL HAVE BEEN DULY CONVICTED.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL REVIVING THE POWERS OF THE COMMISSIONERS FOR ASCERTAINING AND DECI- DING ON CLAIMS TO LAND IN THE DISTRICT OF DETROIT, AND FOR SETTLING THE CLAIMS TO LAND AT GREEN BAY AND PRAIRIE DU CHIEN IN THE TERRITOY OF MICHIGAN.

TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON TERRITORIES THE BILL (3 STAT. L. 493, APP. 3/2/1819), AUTHORIZING THE PEOPLE OF THE SOUTHERN PART OF MISSOURI TO FORM A SEPARATE TERRITORIAL GOVERNMENT WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO AMEND SAID BILL SO THAT THE FURTHER INTRODUCTION F SLAVERY, OR INVOLUNTARY SERVITUDE WITHIN THE SAID TERRITORY EXCEPT FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF CRIMES, BE PROHIBITED.
TO PASS A RESOLUTION RATIFYING THE CONVENTION MADE ON FEB. 27, 1819, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE CHIEFS AND HEAD- MEN OF THE CHEROKEE NATION OF INDIANS.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL TOMORROW THE BILL FIXING THE TIME FOR THE NEXT MEETING OF CONGRESS.
